newsitem.title: USA: US deficit rises then falls under budget pact - aide.
newsitem.headline: US deficit rises then falls under budget pact - aide.

text.p: The budget agreement being worked on between the White House and congressional leaders would increase the deficit in fiscal 1998, before it leveled off and declined to reach balance in 2002, a senior Republican aide said Wednesday.

The Congressional Budget Office has estimated the budget deficit would be $67 billion in fiscal 1997. Based on that projection, under the budget deal the deficit would increase to $80 billion to $85 billion in 1998, level off in 1999, and then fall to about $75 billion in 2000, $40 billion to $50 billion in 2001 before reaching balance in 2002, the aide said.
The aide said the increase in the deficit in fiscal 1998 was a "natural phenomenon" due to tax cuts kicking in before savings from entitlement programs.
